intro: Blakea paleacea, commonly known as the white-flowered Blakea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth, glossy surface. Blakea paleacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
